item.title: Python in RStudio
item.description: Here we are using the reticulate package which includes a python engine for R Markdown. Thus, allowing us to use regex functions to find all the integers in the string below. import re string1 = "We have to extract these numbers 12, 47, 48 The integers numbers are also interesting: 189 2036 314 \',\' is a separator, so please extract these numbers 125,789,1450 and also these 564,90456 We like to offer you 7890$ per month in order to complete this task.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have recently completed: Exploratory Data Analysis with Tidyverse Tools Modeling, Testing, and Classification

item.title: Project 1
item.description: library(dplyr) ## Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 3.6.2 library(tidyverse) ## Warning: package 'tidyverse' was built under R version 3.6.3 ## Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 3.6.3 ## Warning: package 'tidyr' was built under R version 3.6.3 library(lubridate) ## Warning: package 'lubridate' was built under R version 3.6.3 stock <- read.csv("tsla stock.csv") #read TSLA stock stock$Date <- as.Date(stock$Date, format = "%m/%d/%Y") stock <- stock %>% dplyr::mutate(year = lubridate::year(Date), month = lubridate::month(Date), day = lubridate::day(Date)) # read Elon Musk's tweets tweets <- read.

item.title: Project 2
item.description: ##PROJECT 2 Noah Lindley NWL268 ##Introduction My data set is about avocados. My variables are date (year, month, day), avg. price (USD), volume (# of avocados), type(organic/conventional), total bags (bags of avocados). This dataset has 18249 observations. avocado <- read.csv("avocado.csv") #read dataset avocado <- na.omit(avocado) avocado$X <- NULL avocado$region <- NULL avocado$X4046 <- NULL avocado$X4225 <- NULL avocado$X4770 <- NULL # create variables for year/month/day library(lubridate) library(dplyr) avocado$Date <- as.
